originalTitle: Dozens of Muslims 'massacred' in Nigeria for refusing to join jihadists, says governor
title: Dozens of Muslims 'massacred' in Nigeria for refusing to join jihadists, says governor
content: At least 78 bodies have been buried, while there are fears that around 170 people were killed altogether.

originalTitle: At the scene: Muslims killed 'over rejection of extremist ideology' in Nigeria
title: Hearts for Peace: Learning Kindness from Nigeria
content:
Hello, wonderful friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter from Africa, ready to share an important story with you. Today, we're talking about a special country called Nigeria. It's a very big country in Africa, full of amazing people, beautiful places, and lots of different ways of life. Imagine a country where people speak many languages and have many interesting traditions! Nigeria is truly a vibrant place.

Meeting Our Neighbours in Nigeria

In Nigeria, just like where you live, many people live together. They live in towns and villages, big cities and small communities. Some people go to church, and some people go to mosques. These are special places where people pray and learn about their faith. It's like how you might have different games you like to play, but you all play together on the same playground. In Nigeria, people from different faiths have lived side-by-side for a very long time, sharing laughter, food, and friendship. This is called living in peace. Everyone wants to feel happy and safe in their home, with their family and friends. *Did you know?* Nigeria is often called the "Giant of Africa" because it has so many people living there – more than any other country in Africa! It has over 250 different groups of people, each with their own special culture and traditions.

When Things Get Tricky

Sometimes, in life, not everyone agrees on everything. Most times, we can talk about our differences and still be friends. But once in a while, some people have ideas that are not kind. They might think their way is the *only* right way, and they might want others to think exactly like them. When people have these kind of ideas, it can cause problems. It's like when you really want to play one game, but your friend wants to play another, and one of you just won't share the ball or listen to new ideas. These unkind ideas can make people feel like they need to make others change, even if it hurts them.

A Sad Story

Recently, something very sad happened in a part of Nigeria. Some people had these not-so-kind ideas. They wanted everyone to think and act exactly like them. But the people in the community loved their own ways and wanted to live peacefully, respecting everyone. They said, "No, thank you. We like our own ways, and we want to live peacefully." Because these brave people didn't agree with the unkind ideas, some very sad things happened. Many people were hurt, and many people are now gone from their homes and families. It is a very sad time for the families and friends who miss them. We know that many, many people are no longer with us because of these unkind actions. It makes our hearts feel heavy to think about it, because everyone deserves to feel safe and happy with their loved ones. Imagine many, many chairs at a big family gathering that are now empty. That's how sad it feels for some families.

What Does This Mean for Us?

When things like this happen, it reminds us how important it is for everyone to be kind. We learn that it's okay to be different, and it's important to respect everyone's choices, as long as those choices don't hurt anyone else. These people in Nigeria just wanted to live their lives their own way, peacefully. They didn't want to hurt anyone, and they didn't want anyone to hurt them. This sad event reminds us that we must always stand up for kindness and peace, and never let unkind ideas win. *Did you know?* When we respect someone, it means we think they are important and we care about their feelings and choices, even if they are different from ours! Respect helps us be friends even if we like different things.

Hearts Come Together

Even when sad things happen, good people always come together. In Nigeria, after these sad events, many people rushed to help. They shared food, offered comfort, and prayed for the families who were hurting. They showed that even when some people have unkind ideas, there are far more people with big, kind hearts. Communities are strong when people help each other. When one person is sad, a friend can give a hug or a kind word. That's what people in Nigeria are doing for each other now. They are holding hands and helping their neighbours to heal and feel safe again. This is what it means to be part of a caring community.

Building a Safer Tomorrow

The leaders in Nigeria are working very hard to make sure everyone is safe. They want to make sure that these unkind ideas don't spread and that everyone can live in peace, without fear. It's like when a grown-up helps you sort out a problem with a friend – they want to make sure everyone can play happily together again and no one is left out or hurt. They are trying their best to protect all the children and families. We all want Nigeria to be a place where every child can grow up feeling safe and loved, where they can learn and play without worrying about unkindness.

Let's Choose Kindness

This story from Nigeria reminds us of a very important lesson: kindness is always the best choice. When we meet people who are different from us, we can choose to be curious and friendly, instead of being afraid or unkind. We can learn from each other and build a stronger, happier world together. Let's all remember to be kind to everyone, no matter where they come from or what they believe. Together, we can make our world a more peaceful place, full of smiles and shared joy. Every little act of kindness helps make our big world a better place for everyone!
summary: Many people in Nigeria were hurt and lost their lives because they did not agree with some unkind ideas, but now good people are coming together to help each other and choose kindness for a peaceful future.
whyMatters: This is important because it teaches us that everyone deserves to live in peace, and it's always kind to respect other people's choices, even if they are different from ours, so we can all be safe and happy together.

title: Celtic chairman calls for unity over fan boycott plans

title: Arsenal lack of respect behind outburst - Rosenior
